data.title: GATHER INFORMATION
questions: In this phase, recall the basis for your feedback: observations, behaviors, data, etc.
Which progress measures are not being met? By whom?
What is your data/evidence? What are the known facts, not hearsay?
What are your observations? What have you seen/heard yourself?
What stories/anecdotes from others are informing you?
Be wary of using 3rd party information in feedback. Firsthand is best.
What information do you need (and don’t have) to diagnose the situation?

data.title: CHECK ASSUMPTIONS
questions: In this phase, review their situation and your interpretations, assumptions, etc.
What are your unknowns? And what potential unknown unknowns?
What might you be assuming about the person? The situation? The task?
How does this person perceive this task? Importance? Urgency?
What is the person’s mindset about this task? ‘Fixed’ or ‘growth’? Scale 1 – 10.
To what extent is the person aware of his/her non-performance?
On what other projects/tasks is he/she working? How challenging are they?
What ‘other things’ might be impacting their performance of this task?
What changes in their environment could be impacting them?
Did you do everything you could to set them up to succeed?

data.title: ANALYZE + DIAGNOSE
questions: In this phase, dissect their performance, determine root causes, and diagnose.
What’s not meeting expectations: their behavior or their results?
(if both) How does their behavior impact or translate into results?
(if behavior) What kind of behavior(s) need to change?
(if results) Why do you think their performance is ‘off track’?
Could lack of competence—knowledge, skill on this task—be causing it?
(if competence) How might they get training or coaching on this task?
Could lack of motivation or confidence to do the task be causing this?
(if motivation) How might you address their will and/or confidence?
Could lack of time or inefficient use of time be causing non-performance?
(if time) Could you re-prioritize their tasks or help streamline their work?
What else might be causing the lack of performance?
How is their non-performance impacting the team, customer, etc.?
What will happen if you do not address their lack of performance?
What behavior(s) should the person keep, start or stop doing?

data.title: CONSIDER APPROACH
questions: In this phase, consider how you may need to adjust your style with this person.
How comfortable is this person admitting difficulty with a task?
What are their personal need(s) in receiving this feedback?
How will you address those in delivering the feedback?
How will you maintain their self-esteem, and ‘do no harm’?
What or who else do you need to protect in this conversation?
How will you avoid triggering them with respect to SCARF?
Use the module ‘Redirect behavior’ to deliver the feedback, and
Click on the ‘Prepare’ (pre-work) to find human needs relative to SCARF.
